bibl.title: Memorandum concerning William H. Dean Memorial Bridge, [1940]

div1.p: The memorandum includes a transcription of the plaque inscription on the William H. Dean Memorial Bridge, in Grand Rapids, Michigan.

div1.head: Memorandum concerning William H. Dean Memorial Bridge, [1940]
div1.p:
Bronze tablet on Wm. H. Dean Memorial Bridge, Fulton Street over
the Grand River, Grand Rapids, erected and financed by the City of
Grand Rapids. Dedicated September 29, 1928, to Wm. H. Dean, a citizen
of Grand Rapids, born Jan. 6, 1878, died May 3, 1928. Member of the
7th U. S. Cavalry, stationed at Havana, Cuba, 1900, the first from the
ranks to offer himself a martyr in the research of Yellow Fever trans-
mission, giving his health and making the supreme sacrifice. “A noble
deed for humanity's sake”. His death was untimely.
Ref. Michigan History Magazine, Vol. 15: P. 263

Medical History of Michigan compiled and edited by a committee 1930.
Published by Bruce publishing Co. Vol. 1: P. 693-694
